job_description: Data Scientist - Growth Analytics (Performance Marketing)New York, NYMarkets and Subscriber Growth – Operations and Strategy /Permanent /On-siteApply for this jobWe are looking for a Data Scientist to join the Business Analytics team at Spotify. In this role, you’ll shape Spotify’s performance marketing and growth strategy by developing models, designing experiments and measuring the impact of marketing investments. Partnering with the Growth Analytics Lead, you’ll turn data into strategies that guide budget allocation, optimize spend and accelerate efficient growth across paid media channels. You’ll collaborate with a global, cross-functional team of analysts, data scientists, marketers, business leaders, and engineers to scale insights and drive efficient growth. Learning and improving is part of our daily routine, and you will get a platform to develop your data skills and carve out efficient ways of working.The Business Analytics team is part of Spotify’s core business strategy organization. You’ll play a crucial role in the growth and direction of Spotify as we grow to 700M+ users around the globe. At your fingertips, you’ll have access to all of the data Spotify has to offer, and the opportunity to be creative with how you use it to derive insights and strategies. Above all, your work will impact the way the world experiences audio!What You'll DoDevelop data-driven strategies to drive the growth of Spotify users and subscribers, with a focus on performance marketingRefine attribution practices and define robust, data-backed methods to measure the incremental impact of marketing spendPartner with third-party advertising platforms and agencies to design and implement comprehensive experiments and lift studies Contribute to annual and quarterly planning through impact forecasting, budget allocation and scenario modellingBuild scalable data pipelines and dashboards to track marketing efficiency and Global business performanceCollaborate closely with business partners to understand growth drivers and guide strategic marketing decisionsPresent insights and recommendations to senior stakeholders, influencing the course of our businessWho You Are3+ years synthesizing insights from data using tools such as Python/R and SQLHands-on experience supporting marketing organizations with their paid media strategy, including running and analyzing incrementality tests on platforms like Meta, Google and TikTokProven experience building advanced models to understand and optimise paid media campaignsSkilled at collaborating with business partners to measure the impact of marketing initiatives and presenting those findings in coherent recommendationsIntellectually curious, creative, and diligent - you enjoy thinking about the business as much as about the dataHave a background in Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering or other relevant fieldComfortable working on a globally distributed team (with occasional international travel)Where You'll BeThis role is based in New YorkWe offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.The United States base range for this position is $110,018 - $157,169, plus equity. The benefits available for this position include health insurance, six month paid parental leave, 401(k) retirement plan, monthly meal allowance, 23 paid days off, paid flexible holidays, paid sick leave. These ranges may be modified in the future.Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us. Find our AI notice here: https://lifeatspotify.com/ai-noticeApply for this job
title: Data Scientist - Growth Analytics (Performance Marketing)
description:
We are looking for a Data Scientist to join the Business Analytics team at Spotify. In this role, you’ll shape Spotify’s performance marketing and growth strategy by developing models, designing experiments and measuring the impact of marketing investments. Partnering with the Growth Analytics Lead, you’ll turn data into strategies that guide budget allocation, optimize spend and accelerate efficient growth across paid media channels. You’ll collaborate with a global, cross-functional team of analysts, data scientists, marketers, business leaders, and engineers to scale insights and drive efficient growth. Learning and improving is part of our daily routine, and you will get a platform to develop your data skills and carve out efficient ways of working.

The Business Analytics team is part of Spotify’s core business strategy organization. You’ll play a crucial role in the growth and direction of Spotify as we grow to 700M+ users around the globe. At your fingertips, you’ll have access to all of the data Spotify has to offer, and the opportunity to be creative with how you use it to derive insights and strategies. Above all, your work will impact the way the world experiences audio!

The Synthetics Product is a critical pillar of Datadog’s digital experience monitoring portfolio, enabling customers to proactively test, monitor, and optimize the availability and performance of their applications and user journeys. As the Product Solutions Architect (PSA) for Synthetics, you will work closely with Datadog customers and the Synthetics Product and Engineering teams in helping Synthetics users architect, implement best practices, and adopt Datadog at scale. SAs ensure that customer needs have been met and that the solution is fully functioning according to business requirements, governance, and compliance goals. SAs are accountable for the outcome of these initiatives, and frequently collaborate with other Datadog resources to drive measurable success.At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them.What You’ll Do:Serve as the Product Expert on Datadog Synthetics Product.Offer guidance on architecture choices, data collection, and best practices to large Enterprise customers as they adopt these Datadog services across the organization at scale.Be a Trusted Advisor to Product Management by providing high quality feedback based on your field experience working closely with our Support, Partners, and Customers.Capture repeat customer use cases and solutions and in turn publish Reference Architectures and Implementation Guides for Datadog prospect and customer consumption.Build world class training material, solutions briefs, blogs, and documentation to the wider Datadog field technical teams over the latest product features and capabilities.Collaborate with other teams at Datadog including Marketing, Sales, Community, Documentation, and Evangelism to ensure the success of the Synthetics Product amongst the Digital Experience product suite at Datadog.Exercise the products you represent by building small scale deployments and proofs of concepts to verify proposed solutions and reproduce customer environments.Who You Are:Someone with strong experience of synthetics productsSomeone who can dive deep into our Codebase, SDKs, and GitHub processes.Experience with JSON and YAML configuration files, and Terraform for Infrastructure as Code in CI/CD workflows.A self-starter, tech-savvy professional, who is comfortable working with bleeding edge technology and processes, even if it hasn’t been well defined.A deep learner and a Subject Matter Expert today that has built advocacy and knowledge across multiple teams with the knowledge you possess.Strong understanding of client-side, frontend, and backend application performance measurement, including synthetic testing strategies, performance indicators, and common failure modesFluent in understanding the observability market domain, competition, technological shifts, and customer needs, especially specific to synthetics.Constantly finding new and unique solutions to solve hard problems.A person who possesses exceptional listening and consultative skills, for both internal and external audiences.Experienced working with customers in high pressure situations where the solution is sometimes not obvious.Able to sit up to 4 hours, traveling to and from client sites.Able to travel via auto, train, or air up to 40% of the time.Bonus Points:Successful track record with 5+ years experience working as an Architect or Consultant.In-depth knowledge or experience with leading Observability tools (Datadog, New Relic, AppDynamics, Dynatrace, etc.)Experience using Datadog and/or other observability tools in an SRE or DevOps capacity.Experience with application performance tuning.Have proven experience deploying observability in production environments at scale.Experience collaborating with open source projects and active engagement within associated communities.Experience educating customers on AI-enabled systems, including setting expectations around non-deterministic behavior, variability in outputs, and how to design reliable workflows and user experiences around these characteristicsDatadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply.Benefits and Growth:Generous and competitive benefits packageNew hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase planContinuous career development and pathing opportunitiesEmployee-focused best in class onboardingInternal mentor and cross-departmental buddy programFriendly and inclusive workplace cultureBenefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.Datadog offers a competitive salary and equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan.The reasonably estimated yearly salary for this role at Datadog is:$151,500—$222,000 USDAbout Datadog: Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stacks. Built by engineers, for engineers, Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries. Together, we champion professional development, diversity of thought, innovation, and work excellence to empower continuous growth. Join the pack and become part of a collaborative, pragmatic, and thoughtful people-first community where we solve tough problems, take smart risks, and celebrate one another. job_description: Datadog is seeking a seasoned design leader to accelerate the evolution of its core products and help us define what’s next. These products power how engineers visualize, optimize and troubleshoot complex, distributed systems at scale. In this role, you’ll lead a 40-person design team across North America and Europe, shaping how often the invisible world of infrastructure becomes understandable, navigable, actionable and deeply human. It’s an opportunity to craft the design vision for our customers to see, interpret, and act on live data—transforming dense technical signals into experiences that feel clear, intuitive, and empowering.At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. This role is based in New York. What you’ll do:Grow, mentor, and lead a talented and diverse team of global design managers and product designers. Partner with cross-functional partners to establish roadmaps, metrics, and goals.Help the team to Design ahead and set the vision for the user experience to meet customer and business needs. Guide and accelerate your team, oversee multiple workstreams, and connect the dots between cross-org products for your team to deliver a cohesive customer experience.Be the champion for product excellence.You’ll report to the Head of Design and work with peer leaders to strengthen our processes, tools, and design organization.Who You Are:15 years experience in product design with 8 years experience managing managers.Strong experience and portfolio that showcases a track record of design leadership, end-to-end experience ownership, and design excellence. Strong customer advocacy with a penchant for data and business-informed design.Experience of building complex products. Experience of building B2B saas products is desirable but not required.Ability to dabble in the technical breadth and depth of modern software development.Datadog values people from all walks of life. title: Sales Development Representative (Boston)

job_description: Sabre is a technology company that powers the global travel industry. By leveraging next-generation technology, we create global technology solutions that take on the biggest opportunities and solve the most complex challenges in travel. Positioned at the center of the travel, we shape the future by offering innovative advancements that pave the way for a more connected and seamless ecosystem as we power mobile apps, online travel sites, airline and hotel reservation networks, travel agent terminals, and scores of other solutions.Simply put, we connect people with moments that matter.London (Richmond) based role - 3 days per week in the officeJob Description: Web/Digital Specialist IRole PurposeThe Web/Digital Specialist is responsible for improving the performance, usability, and effectiveness of Sabre’s global website. This role blends customer journey insight, information architecture, analytics, SEO, and governance to help us continually improve content effectiveness, site performance, and the overall user journey.Working closely with our Lead Web Designer and our external web development agency, this person acts as the operational owner of the website day-to-day. They ensure our component-based WordPress experience is maintained, optimized, and aligned with business and brand goals.The majority of the role is focused on optimizing the website experience, with additional responsibilities to include analysis of paid media and email to ensure continuity and effectiveness from acquisition channels to onsite engagement.Key Responsibilities1. Website Operations & Content ManagementBuild and publish pages using pre-defined WordPress components and templatesMaintain and update existing content to ensure accuracy and consistencyExecute content changes for marketing campaigns, product launches, and brand initiativesQA changes made by internal teams or the agency to ensure quality, consistency, and accessibilityManage website governance processes (taxonomy, redirects, link hygiene, components usage, compliance)2. Analytics, Insight & Performance Monitoring Analyze website performance to identify which channels, formats and creatives drive the strongest onsite engagement – providing actionable recommendations to the campaign teamConduct behavior analysis (scroll depth, navigation paths, search usage, heatmaps) and identify UX and content improvementsWork with paid media partners/agencies to ensure tracking, UTMs, and measurement frameworks are correctly implemented.Partner with the Lead Web Designer to prioritize optimizations backed by insight3. Experience Optimization & ExperimentationDesign, run and evaluate A/B tests or multivariate experiments on landing pages, content variants, UX flows.Monitor site performance (including Core Web Vitals, page speed) and work with the agency to address issues.Support technical SEO fundamentals (redirects, schema, site health) in collaboration with the agency.4. Creative & Marketing SupportUsing brand templates, produce/adapt visual assets (banners, graphics) and landing pages in support of campaigns.Ensure that digital campaign landing pages are aligned to brand, responsive and optimized for performance.Embed tracking and tagging structure for paid marketing and assist marketing teams with web-related tasks.5. Technical Operations & Vendor CollaborationLiaise with the external web agency for new component builds, template updates, script integrations or advanced technical changes.Manage tickets, requirements, and small-scope briefsOversee implementations like script updates, tracking tools, and minor integrations (no coding required)Maintain documentation and support internal teams with training on component usageSkills & ExperienceMust HaveStrong experience with WordPress or similar component-based CMS platformsExcellent understanding of GA4, website analytics, and performance measurementComfortable interpreting data and turning it into practical recommendationsUnderstanding of UX principles and user journey optimizationStrong attention to detail and consistencyAbility to manage multiple requests from marketing and product teamsExperience supporting landing pages or digital campaignsDesirable (Not Required)Experience with tools like Hotjar, Clarity, or similarFamiliarity with GTM tagging (template-based, not custom coding)Experience with SEO fundamentalsExperience working with web agencies or vendorsFamiliarity with  HTML/CSS JavaScriptKnowledge of paid advertising channels such as LinkedIn, YouTube and programmatic displayWhat this role is – and what it isn’tThis role is: the hands-on digital experience operator, optimizing the website, supporting marketing campaigns, measuring and improving performance, collaborating cross-functionally.This role is not: a full-stack web developer or heavy coder, nor is it purely a designer role. It is not focused exclusively on backend architecture or advanced software engineering.Why you’ll matterWith our website function shifting to a highly engaging, brand-driven experience, this role ensures that we don’t lose agility, measurement and optimization. You’ll make sure we drive continuous improvement – based on analysis and insight, helping campaign teams deliver highly effective campaigns and ensuring we keep raising the bar on digital experience.We will give careful consideration to your application and review your details against the position criteria. You will receive separate notification as your application progresses. Please note that only candidates who meet the minimum criteria for the role will proceed in the selection process.

Research Scientist - PersonalizationNew York, NYData and Analytics – Personalization /Permanent /RemoteApply for this jobSpotify has more than 600M listeners in more than 180 markets around the world, who use our music, podcast, and audiobook services to find what delights, entertains, educates, and informs them. Personalization is a high impact organization that provides the technology to serve them what they expect to find, to help them explore and find new things to enjoy, and to suggest things they might not be aware of that they would like.We are looking for a Research Scientist with a machine learning background to help us improve personalization experiences by integrating and optimizing state-of-the-art generative AI technologies into our recommender systems. You will join a team of machine learning researchers whose focus is on innovating the Spotify experience through researching and developing technologies that power intelligent user experiences for long-term satisfaction.You will be part of an interdisciplinary team focusing on ensuring that the foundations of Spotify technologies are at or above the state of the art and, in the process, redefine the state of the art for the field and contributing to the wider research community by publishing papers. Our team has strong ties internally to product groups as well as externally to the research community.What You'll DoParticipate in groundbreaking research in artificial intelligence and machine learning with a focus on large-scale solutions to optimize recommender systems.Apply your scientific knowledge to analyze and collect data, perform analyses, conduct experiments and identify problems, as well as devise solutions through hands-on development.Work on practical applications such as recommendations and scalable evaluations.Work in collaboration with other scientists, engineers, product managers, designers, user researchers, and analysts across Spotify to design creative solutions to challenging problems.You'll have product impact, while working on and further developing a long-term research roadmap.You will maintain a research profile through external engagement such as publishing, giving talks, and being an active community member at top conferences.Who You AreYou have a Masters or PhD in machine learning, data science, or related areas or are enrolled in an advanced degree program.Demonstrated expertise in machine learning and artificial intelligence through peer-reviewed publications at conferences (such as NeurIPS, KDD, RecSys or related) A solid understanding or past research experience on recommender systems and ability to optimize Generative AI models for new targets, rewards or multiple objectives.Solid hands-on skills in implementing advanced algorithms, as well as sourcing, cleaning, analyzing and modeling of large-scale real data.You're a creative problem-solver who is passionate about digging into complex problems and devising new approaches to reach results.Where You'll BeThis role is based in New York City.We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.The United States base range for this position is $133,195 - $190,278 plus equity. The benefits available for this position include health insurance, six month paid parental leave, 401(k) retirement plan, a monthly meal allowance, 23 paid days off, 13 paid flexible holidays. These ranges may be modified in the future.Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us. Find our AI notice here: https://lifeatspotify.com/ai-noticeApply for this job
title: Research Scientist - Personalization
description:
Spotify has more than 600M listeners in more than 180 markets around the world, who use our music, podcast, and audiobook services to find what delights, entertains, educates, and informs them. Personalization is a high impact organization that provides the technology to serve them what they expect to find, to help them explore and find new things to enjoy, and to suggest things they might not be aware of that they would like.

We are looking for a Research Scientist with a machine learning background to help us improve personalization experiences by integrating and optimizing state-of-the-art generative AI technologies into our recommender systems. You will join a team of machine learning researchers whose focus is on innovating the Spotify experience through researching and developing technologies that power intelligent user experiences for long-term satisfaction.

You will be part of an interdisciplinary team focusing on ensuring that the foundations of Spotify technologies are at or above the state of the art and, in the process, redefine the state of the art for the field and contributing to the wider research community by publishing papers. Our team has strong ties internally to product groups as well as externally to the research community.

job_description: Software EngineerYork, United Kingdom, HybridProduct Development /Regular - Full-time /HybridApply for this jobRole At StarCompliance, we build technology that helps our clients meet complex regulatory obligations. We do this through strong engineering, thoughtful collaboration, and a shared commitment to doing the right thing. We’re looking for a Software Engineer to join one of our Product Engineering teams. This role is well suited to someone early in their career who enjoys learning, working closely with others, and taking pride in producing high-quality software. You’ll be part of a supportive, cross-functional delivery team where work is typically managed using a Kanban-style approach, giving you clarity, focus, and flexibility. You’ll contribute to meaningful features and improvements, learn from experienced engineers, and be encouraged to ask questions, share ideas, and continuously develop your skills. How you work matters here. We value people who are curious, respectful, open to feedback, and who take ownership of their work while supporting those around them. ResponsibilitiesBuild and improve features, enhancements, and fixes based on clear requirements and acceptance criteria. Take ownership of assigned work items and see them through to completion. Write clean, readable, and maintainable code that reflects pride in your work. Ensure appropriate testing is in place for your changes and take responsibility for their quality. Contribute to a shared codebase, following established development standards and ways of workingParticipate in code reviews, learning from others and offering constructive feedbackCommunicate progress, questions, and blockers openly and proactivelyRaise issues or uncertainties early so the team can address them together. Help keep technical documentation clear, accurate, and up to dateSkills and Experience Experience working as part of a collaborative software development team. Experience contributing to a shared codebase using version control. Hands-on experience with Microsoft .NET and C#. Understanding of object-oriented programming concepts. Experience working with relational databases and basic SQL. Experience with web technologies such as JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. Familiarity with modern software delivery practices such as continuous integration. Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset. A positive, proactive approach and willingness to learnMinimum Qualifications Commercial software development experience. Experience with C# and .NET (ASP.NET Framework and/or Core). Experience using Git or a similar version control systemFamiliarity with Microsoft SQL Server or another enterprise relational database. Basic understanding of web application development conceptsRight to work in the country of employment. Integrity and Ethics All StarCompliance employees are expected to commit to a high standard of personal integrity and carry out their responsibilities in an ethical mannersWe may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. title: Associate Manager, Compliance

job_description: Reddit is a community of communities. It’s built on shared interests, passion, and trust, and is home to the most open and authentic conversations on the internet. Every day, Reddit users submit, vote, and comment on the topics they care most about. With 100,000+ active communities and approximately 116 million daily active unique visitors, Reddit is one of the internet’s largest sources of information. For more information, visit www.redditinc.com. The Internal Communications team at Reddit exists to build shared belief, deepen understanding, and strengthen the quality and speed of execution across our workforce. This team manages the flow of information across Reddit, cross-functionally unifying our strategy and creating signal in a global, high-growth company. We are eager to add an exceptional Internal Communications Senior Manager to our ranks. As an individual contributor reporting to the Head of Internal Communications, this individual will be a dedicated business partner to Reddit’s EVP of Advertising Sales and the Global Sales Organization (GSO). This role presents a unique opportunity to spearhead internal communications strategy and execution for one of the company’s largest and most dynamic business functions. This individual should multiply productivity for the Global Sales Organization, bringing Reddit’s Internal Communications pillars to life: Inspire: Build belief in Reddit’s mission, opportunity, and unique company culture Align: Deepen understanding of our strategy, goals, and priorities Improve: Strengthen quality and speed of execution against Reddit’s most critical opportunities This role is required to work from our New York City office three days a week. What You’ll Do Communications Strategy Development: Build a results-driven strategy and an engaging ecosystem of communications programs that positively impact the belief and behavior of GSO employees. Narrative Development: Translate strategic revenue priorities and performance data into engaging and actionable narratives that get etched into memory like viral jingles. Content Development: Develop compelling content formats to share go-to-market priorities, transformation initiatives, and executive communications. Event Design & Facilitation: Design and execute tentpole, organization-wide communication moments like All Hands meetings, AMAs, and more. Change Management: Develop airtight communications plans that result in effective change absorption, business continuity, and revenue growth Culture-Building: Amass and guide an internal network of influencers, thought leaders, and advocates to embed cultural ideals, proliferate continuous feedback, assess change absorption, and nurture multidirectional communication. Impact Measurement & Reporting: Define metrics to evaluate communication effectiveness, demonstrate impact, and enable continuous improvement. Cross-Functional Partnership: Collaborate with the Communications, HR, and Sales Strategy & Operations teams to ensure collective progress against cross-functional priorities. Brand Stewardship: Uphold excellence in clarity, tone, and brand voice across all touchpoints. What You’ll Bring 8+ years in internal or executive communications; technology or media industry preferred. Strong track record of advising and influencing C-level and VP-level leaders. Proven success partnering with Sales and revenue-generating teams. Experience partnering with global teams across time zones. Confidence operating with agency and pace in ambiguity. Exceptional writing, editing, and storytelling abilities. Proficiency in Google Workspace and Slack. High emotional intelligence, strong organizational intuition, and operational discipline. Bachelor's degree in Communications, Journalism, or a related field preferred, but not required. Characteristics for Success in This Role A Zero-to-One Builder: You transform big hypotheses and ideas into tangible initiatives and results. A One-to-Ten Scaler: You scale MVPs into wide-reaching programs and campaigns. A Line Leader: You’re not afraid to jump headfirst into ambiguity and get your hands messy. A Sprinter: You move quickly, internalizing that time is of the essence. An Influencer: You build strong, authentic relationships and influence without authority. A Diligent Listener: You’re adept at teasing out signal by asking strong questions. A Marksman: You’re focused and concise in your writing, elevating only the essential. A Storyteller: You develop and deploy modernized messaging that moves hearts, minds, and hands. A Dreamer: You often find yourself daydreaming, ideating, and asking “what if?” A Human: You break out in hives at the thought of corporate jargon or AI-generated slop. A Good Time: You have a collection of favorite memes/gifs and don’t take yourself too seriously. A Planner: You earmark important moments and skillfully plan backwards to prepare for day 0. Benefits Comprehensive Healthcare Benefits and Income Replacement Programs 401k with Employer Match Global Benefit programs that fit your lifestyle, from workspace to professional development to caregiving support Family Planning Support Gender-Affirming Care Mental Health & Coaching Benefits Flexible Vacation & Paid Volunteer Time Off Generous Paid Parental Leave Pay Transparency: This job posting may span more than one career level. In addition to base salary, this job is eligible to receive equity in the form of restricted stock units, and depending on the position offered, it may also be eligible to receive a commission. Additionally, Reddit offers a wide range of benefits to U.S.-based employees, including medical, dental, and vision insurance, 401(k) program with employer match, generous time off for vacation, and parental leave. To learn more, please visit https://www.redditinc.com/careers/. To provide greater transparency to candidates, we share base pay ranges for all US-based job postings regardless of state. We set standard base pay ranges for all roles based on function, level, and country location, benchmarked against similar stage growth companies. Final offer amounts are determined by multiple factors including, skills, depth of work experience and relevant licenses/credentials, and may vary from the amounts listed below.The base pay range for this position is:$180,200 - $252,300 USDIn select roles and locations, the interviews will be recorded, transcribed and summarized by artificial intelligence (AI). You will have the opportunity to opt out of recording, transcription and summarization prior to any scheduled interviews. During the interview, we will collect the following categories of personal information: Identifiers, Professional and Employment-Related Information, Sensory Information (audio/video recording), and any other categories of personal information you choose to share with us. We will use this information to evaluate your application for employment or an independent contractor role, as applicable. We will not sell your personal information or disclose it to any third party for their marketing purposes. We will delete any recording of your interview promptly after making a hiring decision. For more information about how we will handle your personal information, including our retention of it, please refer to our Candidate Privacy Policy for Potential Employees and Contractors. Reddit is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and is committed to building a workforce representative of the diverse communities we serve. Reddit is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If, due to a disability, you need an accommodation during the interview process, please let your recruiter know.
title: Internal Communications Senior Manager (Global Sales)
